properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   230 Elm St, Somerville, MA 02144This is one of the best Goodwill stores I have ever know. It is huge. It is friendly. The people who run it are really nice and the people who work there are friendly and don\'t seem to hate their jobs passionately as is sometimes the case in a Goodwill or Salvation Army. Every once in a while I get a lucky yarn score here, though rarely do I see needles.

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Coffeelatte855 Seneca Rd, Eugene, ORThis is the "good" Goodwill in town. Clean(er) and pretty well organized. Most of the staff enjoy the thrill of the hunt and share your excitement when you score something wonderful. I\'ve found some vintage photo albums and scrap books, sheet music and dishes at this location.

properties.name: St Vincent de Paul
properties.description: Posted by Coffeelatte 201 Division Ave, Eugene, ORGreat antiques they bring over from Europe (at reasonable prices) and a craft supply area. Reasonable prices for the crafting items. Often have good clothing buys, too.

properties.name: The Goodwill Bins
properties.description: Posted by Gabrielamadeus  1740 Se Ochoco St, Milwaukie, ORYessiree, the infamous goodwill bins. Read this good article if you don\'t already know: (http://www.portlandmercury.com/portland/Content?oid=31773&category=34029) Pay-by-the-Pound misc stratta leftovers from goodwill donations. Lots of junk, and some amazing treasures.

properties.name: The Red Light
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  Vintage, Resale, Trendy, Designer ClothesWarehouse sized vintage, thrift style store, resale. clothes, shoes, jackets, accesories, belts, great halloween spot. they rotate their stock regularly. you know you shop there so dont lie to me.fashionistas abound. moderate prices, face it- they got it all. I like tace very much so i wont say crap about the place thats bad. she\'\'s a cancer. she\'\'s my fam.

properties.name: Value Village
properties.description: Posted by Coffeelatte555 W Centennial Blvd, Springfield, ORMy personal favorite thrift store in town. It is THE spot to buy clothing that\'s never been worn, tags still attached. They carry seasonal decorations that are inexpensive and good for crafting. Good buys on shoes and used household items like dishes and higher quality bed linens. Sometimes carry furniture in good condition. PS - This Springfield is sort of the model for The Simpson\'s hometown, even has that giant horse sculpture at the city entrance, but I am not sure the rider on the real statue is Jebediah Springfield...

properties.name: Value Village Thrift Store
properties.description: Posted by Jason in an old super market building. Used to be a great skateboarding spot on the side.
